Package blockr.command

Class ExecuteCommand

java.lang.Object
blockr.command.ExecuteCommand
All Implemented Interfaces:
Command
public class ExecuteCommand
extends java.lang.Object
implements Command
An implementation of the Command interface. This command is responsible for executing steps in the user-made program in the program area. It needs to update the GameWorld, as well as highlight the correct block in the program area.

  • Constructor Details

    • ExecuteCommand

      public ExecuteCommand​(ExecutionController ec, boolean endExecution)
      Initialises this ExecuteCommand.
      Parameters:
      ec - The ExecutionController this command was created from.
      endExecution - A boolean indicating whether this command was a single-step execute, or a stop-executing command.

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public void execute()
      Executing this command means we need to execute a single step or stop altogether with executing. Luckily, these methods are already present in ExecutionController, so simply calling these is sufficient.
      Specified by:
      execute in interface Command

    • undo

      public void undo()
      Undoes this execute action. This function stops highlighting the current block, and highlights the block which was highlighted when this command was created. Furthermore, it reverts the executionStack of the ExecutionController back to the state it was in before this command was executed. Lastly, it elegantly resets the GameWorld by using the snapshot we obtained by calling the GameWorld.getSnapShot() method to revert it to the state it was in before this command was executed.
      Specified by:
      undo in interface Command
